Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSAllergyIntolerance

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSAllergyIntolerance 0..*BaseAllergy intolerance model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
identifier 0..*IdentifierC.21.1 - Identifier
allergyDescription 0..1stringC.21.2 - Allergy description
typeOfPropensity 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.3 - Type of propensity
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

allergyManifestation 0..*BaseC.21.4 - Allergy manifestation
date 0..1dateTimeC.21.4.1 - Date
severity 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.4.2 - Severity
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

description 0..1stringC.21.4.3 - Description
manifestation 0..*CodeableConceptC.21.4.4 - Manifestation
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT


criticality 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.5 - Criticality
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

onsetDate 0..1dateTimeC.21.6 - Onset date
onsetLifePeriod 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.7 - Onset life period
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

endDate 0..1dateTimeC.21.8 - End date
endDateLifePeriod 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.9 - End date life period
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

status 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.10 - Status
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

certainty 0..1CodeableConceptC.21.11 - Certainty
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT

agentOrAllergen 1..1CodeableConceptC.21.12 - Agent or Allergen
Binding Description (No ValueSet): (preferred): SNOMED CT, ATC, (IDMP / EMA SPOR SMS)

patient 1..1Reference(Patient model)C.21.13 - Subject

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSAllergyIntolerance
title: Allergy intolerance model
description: C.21 - EHDS refined base model for Allergy Intolerance

element.definition: C.21 - EHDS refined base model for Allergy Intolerance
Appointment identifier
Textual description of the allergy or intolerance
This element describes whether this condition refers to an allergy, non-allergy intolerance, or unknown class of intolerance (not known to be allergy or intolerance)

Description of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction including date of manifestation and severity. Example: anaphylactic shock, angioedema (the clinical manifestation also gives information about the severity of the observed reaction). Multiple manifestations could be provided.
Date and time of allergy manifestation
Severity of the clinical manifestation of the allergic reaction.
Description of the event as a whole
Clinical symptoms/signs associated with the Event
Potential risk for future life-threatening adverse reactions when exposed to a substance known to cause an adverse reaction.
Date of onset of allergy, e.g., date of the first observation of the reaction. Partial date could be used. or life period (childhood, adolescence).
Date of onset of allergy, e.g., date of the first observation of the reaction expressed usingor life period (childhood, adolescence, etc.).
Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition)
Date of resolution of the allergy (e.g. when the clinician deemed there is no longer any need to track the underlying condition) exprssed using life period (childhood, … )
Current status of the allergy or intolerance, for example, whether it is active, in remission, resolved, and so on …
Assertion about the certainty associated with a propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
A specific allergen or other agent/substance (drug, food, chemical agent, etc.) to which the patient has an adverse reaction propensity.

binding.description: SNOMED CT, ATC, (IDMP / EMA SPOR SMS)

element.definition: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.
